text:
Broadway, east side, south across Beaver, to Stone St's., showing the New York Produce Exchange Building. Below Stone Street, this thoroughfare changes it's identity to Whitehall Street. The latter continues southward to South Ferry. On the right is Bowling Green Park and it's Steamship Row. Subsequently this will be replaced with the U.S. Custom House.


About 1890

Thru New York Historical Society

1 Beaver Street, north side, between Broadway and New Street, before demolition. Shown is the rear of the building.
Wurts Brothers
May 5, 1904

1 Beaver Street, north side, between Broadway and New Street. After May 1904, these buildings were demolishes to make way for a large building taking up the entire block, which is occupies by the Standard Oil Company.
Wurts Brothers  May 7, 1904

1 Beaver Street, north side, between Broadway and New Street, showing demolition preparatory to erecting the present home of the Standard Oil Company.
Wurts Brothers
June 10, 1904

8-12 and 14-20 Broadway, at and adjoining the N.E. corner of Beaver Street, showing at the corner the Produce Exchange Bank, and north of same the Wells Building.

About 1920.

Gift of E.M. Jenks.

Broadway, east side, north from Beaver Street as seen across Bowling Green, showing prominently three buildings, which in order are the Produce Exchange Bank, the Wells Building and the Standard Oil Building. On the right appears the north side of Beaver Street, east to but not including New Street; the two 5-story buildings between the Bank and the Wells Annex being Nos. 1 and 3.

About 1920.

Gift of E. M. Jenks.

32-34 Broadway, east side, between Beaver Street and Exchange Place, showing the 18-story Marine and Commerce Building. This photograph is taken from Morris Street viewing eastward.
About 1920.

Gift of E. M. Jenks.

Broadway (center to left), at and adjoining the N.E. corner of Beaver Street (center to right) as viewed across Bowling Green and showing the Produce Exchange Bank and Welles Building (No's 8-12 and 14-20 Broadway) under demolition. The additional structures on the north side of Beaver Street, between Broadway and New Street were included slightly later and form the present (1937) site of the south building (24 stories) of the Standard Oil Company. The small 5 story structure appearing between the Bank (corner) and the ell of the Standard Oil Company Building is No. 3 Beaver Street. This set consists of a negative and a positive.

About 1923.

Underwood and Underwood.
Gift of Albert A. Volk Company.

Broadway (center to left), at and adjoining the N.E. corner of Beaver Street (center to right) as viewed across Bowling Green and showing the Produce Exchange Bank and Welles Building (No's 8-12 and 14-20 Broadway) under demolition. The additional structures on the north side of Beaver Street, between Broadway and New Street were included slightly later and form the present (1937) site of the south building (24 stories) of the Standard Oil Company. The small 5 story structure appearing between the Bank (corner) and the ell of the Standard Oil Company Building is No. 3 Beaver Street. This set consists of a negative and a positive.

About 1923.

Underwood and Underwood.
Gift of Albert A. Volk Company.

Broadway (center to left), at and adjoining the N.E. corner of Beaver Street (center to right) as viewed across Bowling Green and showing the Produce Exchange Bank and Welles Building. (No's. 8-12 and 14-20 Broadway) under demolition. The additional structures on the north side of Beaver Street, between Broadway and New Street were included slightly later and form the present (1937) site of the south building (24 stories) of the Standard Oil Company. The small 5 story structure appearing between the Bank (corner) and the ell of the Standard Oil Company is No. 3 Beaver Street. This set consists of a negative and a positive.

About 1923.

Underwood and Underwood.
Gift of Albert A. Volk Company.

Broadway (center to left), at and adjoining the N.E. corner of Beaver Street (center to right) as viewed across Bowling Green and showing the Produce Exchange Bank and Welles Building. (No's. 8-12 and 14-20 Broadway) under demolition. The additional structures on the north side of Beaver Street, between Broadway and New Street were included slightly later and form the present (1937) site of the south building (24 stories) of the Standard Oil Company. The small 5 story structure appearing between the Bank (corner) and the ell of the Standard Oil Company is No. 3 Beaver Street. This set consists of a negative and a positive.

About 1923.

Underwood and Underwood.
Gift of Albert A. Volk Company.

Broadway (center to left), at and adjoining the N.E. corner of
Beaver Street (center to right) as viewed across Bowling Green and
showing the Produce Exchange Bank and Welles Building (No's 8-12 and
14-20 Broadway) under demolition. The additional structures on the
north side of Beaver Street, between Broadway and New Street were in-
cluded slightly later and form the present (1937) site of the south
building (24 stories) of the Standard Oil Company. The small 5 story
structure appearing between the Bank (corner) and the ell of the Standard
Oil Company Building is No. 3 Beaver Street. This set consists of a
negative and a positive.
About 1923.
Underwood and Underwood.
Gift of Albert A. Volk Company.

Broadway, at the N.E. corner of Beaver Street, showing a clearance
where the former Produce Exchange Bank stood. This in conjunction with
No. 3 Beaver Street (the 5 story affair) forms the present (1937) site
of the south building of the Standard Oil Company. This set consists of
a negative and a positive.
About 1923.
Underwood and Underwood.
Gift of Albert A. Volk Company.

Broadway, at the N.E. corner of Beaver Street, showing a clearance
where the former Produce Exchange Bank stood. This in conjunction with
No. 3 Beaver Street (the 5 story affair) forms the present (1937) site
of the south building of the Standard Oil Company. This set consists of
a negative and a positive.
About 1923.
Underwood and Underwood.
Gift of Albert A. Volk Company.

Broadway, east side, south from Beaver, to and including Stone Streets. Also shown is Whitehall Street, (continuation of Broadway), east side, south from and including Stone, to, but not including Bridge Streets. Prominent building shown is the 'produce Exchange, with a portion of Bowling Green in the immediate foreground.

October 6, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

Broadway, north from Beaver (right) to Morris Streets (center), showing at the N.W. corner of the latter point, the curved apex of the 15-story Columbia Building, No. 29 Broadway. The 6-story structure adjacent to same, is the Bank Marmoros, No. 31-33. Note the new 38-story Fred. F. French Building north of the latter. On the left is the Cunard Building structure that faces the curved Standard Oil Building shown on the right.

April 20, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

U.S. Customs House Statue; in rear is New York Produce
Exchange Building
2 Broadway, Manhattan

Federal Art Project
"Changing New York"
Berenice Abbott, photographer

[Note: negative at Museum of the City of New York]
Code I B and I A-3
July 23, 1936

p. 20, Changing New York

Beaver Street, w. to Broadway
Photographer unknown
n.d.

P.L. Sperr collection
Rec'd September 12, 1945
